question: How far am I allowed to fly an open-class UAV?

Yes, always
Only when flying in uncontrolled airspace

question: What is the valid explanation of the OODA decision-making process?

answers.text: UAVs bring many new great opportunities to the European market. Every UAV operator will then have to plan a business around this information, make a decision and act accordingly

Omissions are inevitable during any UAV flight. The opinions of professionals should then be considered and balanced. Based on this information, the UAV operator should make a decision and act accordingly
Objects close to the work should be detected by visual means. A strategy should be developed to avoid them. Based on this strategy, the UAV operator should make a decision and act accordingly

Unusual situations should be constantly monitored through observations. Options for dealing with them should be identified and balanced. Based on this rapid analysis, the UAV operator should make a decision and act accordingly

the right to submit a complaint to a supervisory authority
